entries.text: Don't be sad, it is temporarily down for maintainence, it will be back on Friday October 28, 2016.
entries.title: CPAN testers is down

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Gabor pointed out that some CPAN modules are missing/outdated in Ubuntu. Reddit thread tells us that there are more. May be lend a hand to Debian Perl group
entries.title: Missing and outdated CPAN modules in Ubuntu (Debian)

entries.author: ron_savage
entries.title: GraphViz2 V 2.43 now does image maps

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.title: Perl 5 Porters Mailing List Summary: October 11th - October 17th
Embedding code snippets from other modules and DevelopRequires

entries.author: zakariyya_mughal
entries.text: Zakariyya asked on reddit why there aren't more FOSS desktop applications? He is himself working on one, if you are also working (or worked on one in the past) on a desktop application in Perl, then please do share it with the rest of the world.
entries.title: Perl Desktop Applications for Non-Developers

entries.author: alexey_melezhik
entries.text: SparrowHub is a repository of useful automation scripts. Talk to Alexey if you have any idea for an automation script & want to add it to SparrowHub.
entries.title: SparrowHub Plugins Request

entries.author: dr_stephen_tyler
entries.text: Autovivification in Perl can bite you. Beware of it.
entries.title: Crazy things can happend in dynamically typed languages (such as in Perl)

entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Have you ever given a talk at a conference? If no, then please give one at LPW. If you need help, then Neil would happy to be your LPW talk buddy.
entries.title: Give your first talk at the London Perl Workshop

entries.author: dave_mitchell
entries.text: An update on work done by Dave under his grant for maintaining Perl 5 core.
entries.title: Dave Mitchell's Grant Report

entries.author: aurynn_shaw
entries.text: I came across this blog post about contempt culture & I think it is relevant to our Perl community as well.
entries.title: Contempt Culture

entries.author: sweth_chandramouli
entries.text: Sweth attended a Perl conference after a very long time & he loved it.
entries.title: YAPC::EU Recap

header: Following the release candidate last week, Rakudo Star 2016.10 has been released this week.
One more Perl conference is waiting for you, London Perl Workshop, submit your talk proposals.
subject: Rakudo Star Release
